name: Jin Jiang Tower Hotel
detail: Great location and classy hotel we enjoyed our stay
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: The PuLi Shanghai
detail: Good looking contemporary chinese elegance. Staff was excellent. Pool is amazing! Food very good. Rooms are fine but not as large as others seen in Shanghai. Needed some work on painting, blemishes, wood marks etc. Nothing major but would be nice to add. Overall great experience. Like it very much
area: Jing'an and SHA Railway Station,Shanghai - View on map

name: City Hotel
detail: This was a great room, large, very clean and well appointed.
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: Campanile Hotel - Shanghai Jing'an Temple
detail: I have not written a hotel review for a long time although I have been staying in hotels more in the past year. It's mainly because I have not came across anything new or interesting that intrigues me until my recent stay here. As you entered the hotel, you feel like you're at a chic hipster cafe. There are plenty of co-working, playing and dining spaces that are not only well-decorated but also functional. The same goes with their bed and shower rooms. I really love the colourful, urban decor which also gives a cozy homey feeling. I stayed at a much more expensive hotel the next day but Campanile offered what looked like better value for money in terms of the complimentary toiletry products and the pack of fantastic French butter cookies they provide to guests. The reception staff were friendly, pleasant and helpful. Honestly, I haven't been stimulated by the environment surrounding a hotel for a long time. I would stay here without any hesitation if I visit Shanghai again.
area: Jing'an and SHA Railway Station,Shanghai - View on map

name: YaTi by Artyzen Hongqiao Shanghai
detail: It was my first time to stay at CitizenM. Location is convenient that it was closed to a huge shopping mall (about 5 mins walk). Suitable for business traveller and people who would like to explore the Hongqiao dist. as it’s closed to National Convention Centre and Hongqiao airport. A young and energetic hotel that brighten our trip in Shanghai. The room surprised me as it was very smart that I could customise lights, AC, blinds, media via an iPad. In addition, I liked how the bathroom used aircraft-like materials and looked very refreshing. We had a lot of fun staying at citizenM with its facilities and its artistic interior design and ornaments. The breakfast was also delicious and my friends and I loved it! Would recommend it to friends and family.
area: Hongqiao Airport and National Convention Center,Shanghai - View on map

name: Jin Jiang Hotel
detail: We have stayed at many Jin Jiang hotels in China, but this was our first time staying at the flagship hotel in Shanghai. We were very impressed with the quality, cleanliness, and professionalism of the staff. Booking through agoda gave us the opportunity we probably wouldn't have otherwise had to stay at this 5-star hotel because of the great value offered. Interesting to note that many famous people have stayed there previously, including Reagan, Thatcher, and Deng Xiao Ping. It was also very convenient to Metro's line 1 and within walking distance to many stops and restaurants. The staff was always very helpful in calling a taxi for us when necessary, however. The only slight negative was the fact that there are many entrances on the Jin Jiang site which can become a little confusing to new guests and taxi drivers; however, the staff was always available to guide and deliver us where we needed to go. We would definitely stay there again in the future - with agoda's help, of course!
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: Merry Hotel Shanghai
detail: I requested 2 connecting rooms when I booked the rooms online, but No when I checked in. I requested 2 connecting rooms for my second visit at the reception counter, make sure I can get the connecting rooms for my second visit, but No at my second visit as well. So, better don't show special request column. The cardkey didn't work for my parents' room several times at my second visit, need to improve! Besides the above, the room is clean every visit, the bell service is good. The internet is slow as usual, and need to pay for it which is free at the most of the Shanghai hotels. Overall, it is a good hotel with the reasonable price.
area: Jing'an and SHA Railway Station,Shanghai - View on map

name: Jinglai Hotel – Shanghai South Bund Xintiandi Branch
detail: Will definitely book this again when I come back in Shanghai
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: Oriental Riverside Bund View Hotel
detail: This is a large, Chinese, modern, 4 or 5 star hotel, not brand new but a clean hotel. It is almost on the riverfront. You get a choice of river view or other and pay accordingly. There are a handful of restaurants along the river front, and of course the ubiquitos Starbucks. Some are bars, some cafes, some restaurants. Just take yourself along for a wander and explore. It is a great view of Shanghai, seeing the Bund from Pudong s the best way to see it, especially if you settle down for a bite or a drink. All the options looked dcent, tho perhaps it can be a bit quiet. The hotel is across the road road from the Super Brand shopping mall. Getting a taxi is not too bad, but if there is either a queue, or you just don't see any taxis, then walk over to the mall where there is usually a few of them waiting on the corner. If you dont fancy the standard, expensive buffet breakfast, take yourself over to the mall to Starbucks, or Lavazza or one of the local options. There is also a metro station just a few minutes walk away.
area: Lujiazui and New Int'l Expo Center Pudong,Shanghai - View on map

name: Conrad Shanghai
detail: Overall, Conrad Shanghai made my trip a memorable one.
area: People Square and South Bund Huangpu,Shanghai - View on map
